Job Description: Will Support Friendship & Wautoma Clinics. The Community Recovery Specialist (CRS) is a community based and integrated essential member of the Community Recovery Program team who works with participants, treatment providers and other community partners to encourage the recovery of program participants. The CRS is responsible for identifying and responding to individuals seeking treatment, connecting them to comprehensive Mental Health/Substance Abuse/Primary Care assessment and monitoring and ensuring ongoing treatment. This position works with the Program Director and Consortium members in organizing and maintaining community engagement and community advisory bodies. The CRS works closely with local County Human Services Departments and other community partners to ensure an integrated treatment plan that is person centered and team focused and reflects assessments of both psychosocial and recovery goals. From intake evaluation through discharge, the CRS provides support, structure, and accountability for the successful recovery of program participants.

Why TaraVista Behavioral Health Center?
At TaraVista, we haven’t forgotten the reason behind why we went into healthcare. Like you, we have a calling to help people - to make a real and meaningful difference in their lives. Also like you, we’re frustrated that ‘business’ and ‘process’ seem to come at the expense of our patients, and compromise our ability to work effectively as teams.
We believe that behavioral healthcare doesn’t have to be an ‘either/or’ choice between proper business and proper treatment - we believe we can truly do well by doing good.
Join our TV team where values like collaboration, compassion, engagement, and respect are the very real foundations of our culture – not just ideals in a job post. Reconnect with the reasons you chose to work in healthcare and shift from simply having a career, to really living your calling. We provide inpatient behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.

Litmus Test: Are we compatible?
Integrity, flexibility, empathy, and excellence are our company values. They motivate us to keep a vibrant company culture that comes through in all we do. Everyone who fits well into our company culture does these things:
This company values your feedback and constructive criticism regarding management, administration, and company policies and procedures. Let your direct supervisor know when you have input.
Pair your complaints and criticisms with solutions.
Instead of saying some version of “that’s not my job” when someone asks you to do something, try some version of “let me see if I can help.” We love delegation and job descriptions too, but it makes for a better workplace when your teammates show a sense of excitement about supporting one another.

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 74% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

License Requirements: ADT, CAC-AD, CSC-AD
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
Responsible for providing the patients with services outlined in the Core functions of an Alcohol and Drug Counselor in consultation with other professionals. To include: treatment planning, client education, counseling (individual and group), report and record keeping, case management, crisis intervention and referral.
Responsible for completing the Comprehensive Substance Abuse Assessment (CSAA) within 2 days for Intensive Outpatient (IOP) clients and within 2 weeks for Outpatient (OP) clients.

About us
Hickory Recovery Network and Hickory Treatment Centers – Indianapolis offers 28-day customized treatment plans, utilizing the best therapeutic modalities available. We provide detox services as well as a residential treatment program. Our licensed therapists combine a wide range of evidence-based therapies in ways that work for each individual patient. If you or a loved one is in need of alcohol or drug addiction treatment for substances such as heroin or methamphetamines, our staff can provide the clinical and medical help needed to get on the path towards long-term sobriety and recovery.
Candidates must be trained in anxiety and mood disorders and provide individual, group, and family therapies. Experience in DBT, EMDR, Trauma, CBT and MI are highly desirable. Therapists will treat a selected caseload of female and male clients suffering from substance abuse and behavioral health issues. These clinicians must be able to perform bio-psychosocial assessments and participate in multi-disciplinary treatment and discharge planning for clients. Close communication with family members and referents is also required.

Overview:
$2,000 Sign On Bonus!
Remote hires not included, must be an in-office staff member.

Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 74% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Unity Place of Atlantic County is an established Mental Health and Substance Abuse Outpatient program that has worked with thousands of clients over its multi-year history. Based in Atlantic County, our dedicated team of caring professionals have established a reputation of clinical excellence in Atlantic, Gloucester, Burlington, Salem and Camden counties. During the COVID-19 pandemic we shifted our services from on-site to 100% Telehealth. We are now well in to our re-opening phase which consists of a mix of on-site, face-to-face services combined with ongoing Telehealth. The re-opening phase is designed to provide for the needs of those clients who are seeking in-person, face-to-face services while recognizing the needs of clients who may have concerns with in-person services and choose to remain on Telehealth at the current time. This combined, mix of services will require successful candidates to work from our Unity Place facility in Hammonton, NJ.
Please note that as a Healthcare facility, we are working closely with the State of New Jersey to ensure that any in-person services will strictly follow CDC guidelines for Covid-19 safety in accordance with the governor's executive order 252 and executive directive 21-011.

Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 74% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Our mission is to provide a network of high quality substance use service and support facilities that offer each client the clinical and continuing care services they need to achieve long term sobriety. The Raleigh House provides comprehensive services including medically supported detox, intensive residential treatment, and partial hospitalization and intensive outpatient programming.

Job Description:
Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling (ADAC)

General Purpose

Provide treatment and support to assist patients in their recovery from addictions, such as alcoholism and drug addiction, assist with modifying problem behaviors; also provide counseling services to families of patients through an outpatient setting as necessary.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities

? Conduct screening interviews to determine the need for a drug and alcohol assessment

? Conduct confidential, quality assessments, utilizing ASAM criteria to determine the appropriate level of care

? Evaluate a client?s needs and determine if referrals to other programs or facilities is needed

? Based on assessments, make referrals to the most appropriate programs and agencies in an effort to help clients access the right level of care to best meet their treatment needs?

? Work closely with clients to engage them in the decision-making process and help them understand the benefits of assessment and accessing the appropriate level of care as indicated

? Prepare individual treatment plan for each assigned client;

? Work collaboratively with clients and ADAC treatment team members to help support clients in their treatment and recovery

? Collect and review referral information upon assignment of clients from the referral source and consult with others as needed to support coordination of services?

? Conducts individual counseling sessions, under supervision, as scheduled and documents as required;

? Conducts group and/or family sessions, under supervision, as scheduled and documents as required;

? Provide clinical consultation to referral resources.??

? Provide crisis intervention if necessary

? Complete paperwork requirements and maintain quality, up-to-date clinical records. Ensures all documentation regarding patient care, treatment and incidents are completed timely and in a clear, concise manner;

? Consult with supervisor as required by agency policy and state regulations

? Maintain working knowledge of other drug and alcohol treatment agencies and programs and a list of resources that can be shared with clients

? Remain in compliance with internal and external policies, procedures, regulations, and standards, including all of ADAC?s policies and procedures and Quality Assurance Plan, State Licensing standards, NAADAC Professional Code of Ethics;

? Participate in all assigned meetings, staff development, and training as required?

? Maintain license including renewal and reporting any changes when necessary?

? Maintain and continue education requirements (CEU?s)

Education, Experience, and Certification

Education requirements as determined by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists for CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure.

Trainee or Supervised experience as approved by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists for CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure. Familiarity and knowledge with relevant software, assessments, case management, and record keeping.

CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure awarded by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists.

Key Competencies

? Communication skills ? written and verbal

? Planning and organizing

? Prioritizing

? Problem assessment and problem solving

? NAADAC Professional Code of Ethics

? ASAM criteria

? DSM-V criteria

? Information gathering and monitoring

? Attention to detail and accuracy?

? Time management

? Flexibility

? Adaptability?

? Teamwork?

Due to the growing need of substance abuse counseling in our area, an Alcohol & Drug Trainee at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling must be ready and prepared to work at a fast pace. ADAC receives multiple calls from various referral sources throughout each day inquiring information about mutual clients. A counselor must have records up to date in order to relay accurate and timely information to referral sources regarding client attendance, progress, toxicology results, etc. Communication during every work day at ADAC is essential and any unusual occurrences must always be documented. Due to the nature of those we serve it is also important to remember to remain calm in high pressure situations and to respect the needs of these individuals. The clinical staff, including counselors and supervisors, are here to assist you through the learning process and encourage your growth as a counselor. Utilizing the clinical team as well as the administrative team at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling is a great way to clarify questions, familiarize yourself with new material, and solicit advice in a comfortable and supportive environment. Team work is the key to every position at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling.??

Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Shoreline
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professionals or Trainees to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or Licensed SUDP Trainee. This position will be based at our Shoreline branch.

After Hours Crisis Worker Positions Openings
Innervisons Counseling has 2 openings for afterhours Crisis Workers – 4:30 p.m. – 11”00 p.m. or 11:00 p.m.-8:00 a.m. Must be willing to work a minimum of one full weekend per month (Friday thru Sunday). Wage will be discussed at the interview.
Qualifications – Bachelors or master’s degree. Training through UW-Green Bay, to understand the role and details of the Crisis Worker, as well as learning how the Statutes apply to Crisis Work. Qualified candidates should have experience as a Social Worker, Professional Counselor, or Mental Health work experience. Attending the yearly Crisis Worker Conference.
The job includes assessing and evaluating situations, identifying, and proposing solutions to a problem(s), providing support, and sharing possible stress reduction techniques. Individuals who might qualify, may include experience working with individuals having mental and behavioral issues,as well as persons with substance abuse challenges. The positions entail in person contact that maybe at Mile Bluff Medical Center-ER, Juneau County Jail, Mauston Police Department Officers, Juneau County Sheriff Department, Telephone Crisis Line Call(s), and working with Juneau County Dispatch.

Lebanon

· Provide group and individual therapy
· Maintain timely documentation, notes and updates to the treatment plan
· Mix of day and evening hours
· Competitive pay - $30-$35 p/h for PT

Why TaraVista Behavioral Health Center?
At TaraVista, we haven’t forgotten the reason behind why we went into healthcare. Like you, we have a calling to help people - to make a real and meaningful difference in their lives. Also like you, we’re frustrated that ‘business’ and ‘process’ seem to come at the expense of our patients, and compromise our ability to work effectively as teams.
We believe that behavioral healthcare doesn’t have to be an ‘either/or’ choice between proper business and proper treatment - we believe we can truly do well by doing good.
Join our TV team where values like collaboration, compassion, engagement, and respect are the very real foundations of our culture – not just ideals in a job post. Reconnect with the reasons you chose to work in healthcare and shift from simply having a career, to really living your calling. We provide inpatient behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.

Job Title: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)
Job Description:
The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in approved work settings. The CASAC provides comprehensive assessment services to clients who may have substance abuse barriers to employment by applying clinical judgment to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. This is an 1199 Union Position
KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provide integrated care services to the client population at the ACDP clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice
Provide clients with services in the filed as required

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Utilizing evidence-based, trauma informed and person-centered practices, and helping clients access appropriate ancillary support services, RCA’s Outpatient Substance Abuse Counselor (LPC, LMHC, LCSW, LCADC, LMFT, PhD) help patients develop and sustain coping skills that support their recovery journey.

A little about us: ‘Ohana Makamae “HOME”, Mohala I Ka Wai Ka Maka O Ka Pua. (Unfolded by the water are the faces of the flowers.)
On the eastern side of the beautiful island of Maui, there is a small town called Hana. It is the beating heart of East Maui and the home of “Ohana Makamae.
A place where hope dwells, renewal emerges, and healing gains strength.

Job Title: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)
Job Description:
The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in approved work settings. The CASAC provides comprehensive assessment services to clients who may have substance abuse barriers to employment by applying clinical judgment to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. This is an 1199 Union Position
KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provide integrated care services to the client population at the ACDP clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice
Provide clients with services in the filed as required

Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Shoreline
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professionals or Trainees to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or Licensed SUDP Trainee. This position will be based at our Shoreline branch.

Starting pay range: $25-$29/hr.
Schedule: Monday to Friday (no weekends)
Center Point’s mission is to provide comprehensive social, educational, vocational, medical, psychological, housing and rehabilitation services to combat social problems such as substance abuse, poverty, unemployment and homelessness.
Center Point is seeking compassionate and enthusiastic individuals with a desire to teach to join one of our exciting teams as a Certified SUD / AOD Counselors at California State Prison,San Quentin (SQ), and other institutions in Northern California.
About the Position:

$5,000 Sign-On Bonus Available!
Hours: 1pm-9:30pm
As a Remote Substance Abuse Counselor, you'll be a part of our exciting mission of helping millions of people jumpstart their recovery. Your clinical and social work expertise will aid in patient recovery, as you support and implement evidence-based techniques while making a difference in the lives of patients, their families, and communities. Our Substance Abuse Counselors pave the way in various therapy settings, teach patients to overcome the past, and provide the skills and strategies needed to overcome addiction.
Specific Responsibilities:
Inspire and motivate clients to help them develop tools to work toward recovery using evidence-based and person-centered practices.

Why TaraVista Behavioral Health Center?
At TaraVista, we haven’t forgotten the reason behind why we went into healthcare. Like you, we have a calling to help people - to make a real and meaningful difference in their lives. Also like you, we’re frustrated that ‘business’ and ‘process’ seem to come at the expense of our patients, and compromise our ability to work effectively as teams.
We believe that behavioral healthcare doesn’t have to be an ‘either/or’ choice between proper business and proper treatment - we believe we can truly do well by doing good.
Join our TV team where values like collaboration, compassion, engagement, and respect are the very real foundations of our culture – not just ideals in a job post. Reconnect with the reasons you chose to work in healthcare and shift from simply having a career, to really living your calling. We provide inpatient behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.

Schedule: Part-time

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professionals or Trainees to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or Licensed SUDP Trainee. This position will be based at our Shoreline branch.

A little about us: ‘Ohana Makamae “HOME”, Mohala I Ka Wai Ka Maka O Ka Pua. (Unfolded by the water are the faces of the flowers.)
On the eastern side of the beautiful island of Maui, there is a small town called Hana. It is the beating heart of East Maui and the home of “Ohana Makamae.
A place where hope dwells, renewal emerges, and healing gains strength.
“Ohana Makamae “Precious Family”.

Therapeutics is an innovative opioid recovery treatment facility with the vision of enabling clients to live happy, stable lives and return to being productive members of their communities. Our commitment is to help clients achieve recovery through the use of medical, psychosocial and support services. Therapeutics is certified by state, federal and national regulatory bodies and only employs licensed, credentialed professionals.
Moreover, we insist that clients are treated with respect and flexibility. We are looking for team members that appreciate an outstanding work environment and are fulfilled by being a part of the solution to a national epidemic.
This position is focused on providing psychosocial services for clients that receive medication to combat addiction to opioids and may experience co-occurring disorders.
The Company has job openings in Pontiac, Walled Lake, Ann Arbor and Monroe. Candidate should be comfortable with very early hours (6:00 AM starting time). There is an option to work full time.

About us
Amethyst House provides a foundation for recovery by partnering with individuals, families, and communities impacted by substance-use disorders, offering high-quality residential and outpatient treatment services and guidance for healthy living. We offer residential and outpatient treatment services.
Be a member of a multidisciplinary treatment team. Facilitate group and individual counseling sessions at an agency that provides residential and outpatient services for people with drug and alcohol addiction. Complete comprehensive biopsychosocial assessments, maintain accurate and detailed electronic health records.
Master's Degree in social service required; experience in addictions preferred

We are looking for a compassionate, empathetic individual with a background in substance abuse counseling to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with our patients on an individual basis, helping them understand the nature of their addiction and providing them with the tools they need to establish new sober lifestyles. The right individual for this role will have intimate knowledge of addiction, be able to help people affected by addiction on an individual basis, and be able to work well with peers.
Responsibilities:
Counsel clients on the dangers of drug and alcohol use.
Understand the disease theory.
Understand issues that co-occur with substance abuse.

Clinical Social Worker/ Substance Abuse Counselor
Provide clinical services to our patients in a manner consistent with ethical and clinical practice. We are seeking a highly motivated team member who is able to work independently and deliver individualized care to our patients.
Requirements:
Master’s degree in Social Work, Counseling, or related field. MUST be Licensed in the State of Kentucky
Examples include: LCSW, LPCC, LMFT, LCADC, CSW, LPCA or MFTA
Proactive in determining obstacles and how to overcome them.
Adaptable to new polices and workflows.

JOB SUMMARY
The Clinician is responsible for providing confidential addiction counseling, education and support to individuals, families, and the community, and for promoting healthy lifestyles and healthy choices. Under the supervision of a Clinical Director, the Clinician will provide addiction services including, but not limited to, assessment, group, individual, and family sessions, and other modalities to patients and their families according to demonstrated competence.
DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Completing Biopsychosocial Assessments on patients being admitted to the program.
Completing Self Harm and Risk Screens.
Assessing patients for substance disorders using the DSM 5

About Us
Magnolia Medical Group is a Denver based addiction treatment center that specializes in the treatment of those addicted to opioids and opioid related medications. Our addiction treatment program involves individual addiction counseling and drug regimens designed to lessen opioid dependency. This is done under the care of our board certified addiction medicine Medical Director, and licensed addiction counselors.
Job Description
Seeking Part-Time or Full Time experienced Substance Abuse Therapist for an addiction recovery program in a Suboxone clinic. Some evening and occasional weekend work required.
Responsibilities:
Company Name:
Magnolia Medical Group Addiction Treatment Center
4.1

Job Description:
Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Whether someone is dealing with mental illness, stress, depression, anxiety, child and adolescent problems, relationship or family problems Alarus clinicians believe in helping clients find his or her way without judgment. Alarus believes in meeting clients where they are to help facilitate change and find balance in their lives.

After Hours Crisis Worker Positions Openings
Innervisons Counseling has 2 openings for afterhours Crisis Workers – 4:30 p.m. – 11”00 p.m. or 11:00 p.m.-8:00 a.m. Must be willing to work a minimum of one full weekend per month (Friday thru Sunday). Wage will be discussed at the interview.
Qualifications – Bachelors or master’s degree. Training through UW-Green Bay, to understand the role and details of the Crisis Worker, as well as learning how the Statutes apply to Crisis Work. Qualified candidates should have experience as a Social Worker, Professional Counselor, or Mental Health work experience. Attending the yearly Crisis Worker Conference.
The job includes assessing and evaluating situations, identifying, and proposing solutions to a problem(s), providing support, and sharing possible stress reduction techniques. Individuals who might qualify, may include experience working with individuals having mental and behavioral issues,as well as persons with substance abuse challenges. The positions entail in person contact that maybe at Mile Bluff Medical Center-ER, Juneau County Jail, Mauston Police Department Officers, Juneau County Sheriff Department, Telephone Crisis Line Call(s), and working with Juneau County Dispatch.

Why TaraVista Behavioral Health Center?
At TaraVista, we haven’t forgotten the reason behind why we went into healthcare. Like you, we have a calling to help people - to make a real and meaningful difference in their lives. Also like you, we’re frustrated that ‘business’ and ‘process’ seem to come at the expense of our patients, and compromise our ability to work effectively as teams.
We believe that behavioral healthcare doesn’t have to be an ‘either/or’ choice between proper business and proper treatment - we believe we can truly do well by doing good.
Join our TV team where values like collaboration, compassion, engagement, and respect are the very real foundations of our culture – not just ideals in a job post. Reconnect with the reasons you chose to work in healthcare and shift from simply having a career, to really living your calling. We provide inpatient behavioral health services to children, adolescents and adults.

Mental Health Counselor

Job Title: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)
Job Description:
The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in approved work settings. The CASAC provides comprehensive assessment services to clients who may have substance abuse barriers to employment by applying clinical judgment to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. This is an 1199 Union Position
KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provide integrated care services to the client population at the ACDP clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice
Provide clients with services in the filed as required

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Responsibilities:



Qualifications:

We are looking for a compassionate, empathetic individual with a background in substance abuse counseling to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with our patients on an individual basis, helping them understand the nature of their addiction and providing them with the tools they need to establish new sober lifestyles. The right individual for this role will have intimate knowledge of addiction, be able to help people affected by addiction on an individual basis, and be able to work well with peers.
Responsibilities:
Counsel clients on the dangers of drug and alcohol use.
Understand the disease theory.
Understand issues that co-occur with substance abuse.

Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professional Trainees at our Everett branch to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or SUDP Trainee.

We are looking for a compassionate, empathetic individual with a background in substance abuse counseling to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with our patients on an individual basis, helping them understand the nature of their addiction and providing them with the tools they need to establish new sober lifestyles. The right individual for this role will have intimate knowledge of addiction, be able to help people affected by addiction on an individual basis, and be able to work well with peers.
Responsibilities:
Counsel clients on the dangers of drug and alcohol use.
Understand the disease theory.
Understand issues that co-occur with substance abuse.

Counselor Job Description:
Responsibilities include providing direct/indirect therapy services to outpatients who require or will benefit from therapy skills and interventions. This includes, but is not limited to:
Provides individual and group services.
Provides case management services to coordinate care with primary care doctors, other prescribing physicians, probation, parole, child/adult services, and other supporting services
Attends all clinic team meetings and company trainings
Communicates at a level that reflects above average quality work
Maintain client records and other data as required by regulatory agencies in a timely manor

JOB SUMMARY
The Clinician is responsible for providing confidential addiction counseling, education and support to individuals, families, and the community, and for promoting healthy lifestyles and healthy choices. Under the supervision of a Clinical Director, the Clinician will provide addiction services including, but not limited to, assessment, group, individual, and family sessions, and other modalities to patients and their families according to demonstrated competence.
DUTIES, RESPONSIBILITIES, & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Completing Biopsychosocial Assessments on patients being admitted to the program.
Completing Self Harm and Risk Screens.
Assessing patients for substance disorders using the DSM 5

Clinical Social Worker/ Substance Abuse Counselor
Provide clinical services to our patients in a manner consistent with ethical and clinical practice. We are seeking a highly motivated team member who is able to work independently and deliver individualized care to our patients.
Requirements:
Master’s degree in Social Work, Counseling, or related field. MUST be Licensed in the State of Kentucky
Examples include: LCSW, LPCC, LMFT, LCADC, CSW, LPCA or MFTA
Proactive in determining obstacles and how to overcome them.
Adaptable to new polices and workflows.

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Job Title: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)
Job Description:
The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in approved work settings. The CASAC provides comprehensive assessment services to clients who may have substance abuse barriers to employment by applying clinical judgment to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. This is an 1199 Union Position
KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provide integrated care services to the client population at the ACDP clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice
Provide clients with services in the filed as required

Help clients develop treatment goals and plans.
Review and recommend treatment options with clients and their families.
Help clients develop skills and behaviors necessary to recover from their addiction or modify their behavior.

Therapist needed! We are looking for people who understand the power of relationships in creating change. Our therapists work with clients and families who desire change but need the assistance of someone who can help move them in ways that they have not done before.
We have a strong attachment focus with a unique perspective on how attachment impacts both mental health and substance abuse. In our work treating young adult women ages 18-24 we have feel passionately about treating trauma and we will assist in helping each therapist become EMDR trained.

This length of stay provides the therapist an opportunity to do amazing work and assist in leading the treatment team to help these young women become healthy, strong and influential in their communities.

Litmus Test: Are we compatible?
Integrity, flexibility, empathy, and excellence are our company values. They motivate us to keep a vibrant company culture that comes through in all we do. Everyone who fits well into our company culture does these things:
This company values your feedback and constructive criticism regarding management, administration, and company policies and procedures. Let your direct supervisor know when you have input.
Pair your complaints and criticisms with solutions.
Instead of saying some version of “that’s not my job” when someone asks you to do something, try some version of “let me see if I can help.” We love delegation and job descriptions too, but it makes for a better workplace when your teammates show a sense of excitement about supporting one another.

Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Everett
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professional Trainees at our Everett branch to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or SUDP Trainee.

Therapeutics is an innovative opioid recovery treatment facility with the vision of enabling clients to live happy, stable lives and return to being productive members of their communities. Our commitment is to help clients achieve recovery through the use of medical, psychosocial and support services. Therapeutics is certified by state, federal and national regulatory bodies and only employs licensed, credentialed professionals.
Moreover, we insist that clients are treated with respect and flexibility. We are looking for team members that appreciate an outstanding work environment and are fulfilled by being a part of the solution to a national epidemic.
This position is focused on providing psychosocial services for clients that receive medication to combat addiction to opioids and may experience co-occurring disorders.
The Company has job openings in Pontiac, Walled Lake, Ann Arbor and Monroe. Candidate should be comfortable with very early hours (6:00 AM starting time). There is an option to work full time.

Job Title: Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC)
Job Description:
The Credentialed Alcoholism and Substance Abuse Counselor (CASAC) provides alcoholism and substance abuse counseling services in approved work settings. The CASAC provides comprehensive assessment services to clients who may have substance abuse barriers to employment by applying clinical judgment to determine appropriate treatment needs and levels of care. This includes performing diagnostic assessment, evaluation, intervention, referral and alcoholism and/or substance abuse counseling in both individual and group settings. This is an 1199 Union Position
KEY ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Provide integrated care services to the client population at the ACDP clinic as indicated by the OASAS, CCBHC expansion scope of practice
Provide clients with services in the filed as required

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Qualifications:

Requirements:
A SUD counselor candidate must be Certified with CADTP, CAADE or CCAPP per California DHCS regulations.
Preference will be given to SUD counselors who have experience with medication assisted treatments used in addiction treatment programs.

Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling (ADAC)

General Purpose

Provide treatment and support to assist patients in their recovery from addictions, such as alcoholism and drug addiction, assist with modifying problem behaviors; also provide counseling services to families of patients through an outpatient setting as necessary.

Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities

? Conduct screening interviews to determine the need for a drug and alcohol assessment

? Conduct confidential, quality assessments, utilizing ASAM criteria to determine the appropriate level of care

? Evaluate a client?s needs and determine if referrals to other programs or facilities is needed

? Based on assessments, make referrals to the most appropriate programs and agencies in an effort to help clients access the right level of care to best meet their treatment needs?

? Work closely with clients to engage them in the decision-making process and help them understand the benefits of assessment and accessing the appropriate level of care as indicated

? Prepare individual treatment plan for each assigned client;

? Work collaboratively with clients and ADAC treatment team members to help support clients in their treatment and recovery

? Collect and review referral information upon assignment of clients from the referral source and consult with others as needed to support coordination of services?

? Conducts individual counseling sessions, under supervision, as scheduled and documents as required;

? Conducts group and/or family sessions, under supervision, as scheduled and documents as required;

? Provide clinical consultation to referral resources.??

? Provide crisis intervention if necessary

? Complete paperwork requirements and maintain quality, up-to-date clinical records. Ensures all documentation regarding patient care, treatment and incidents are completed timely and in a clear, concise manner;

? Consult with supervisor as required by agency policy and state regulations

? Maintain working knowledge of other drug and alcohol treatment agencies and programs and a list of resources that can be shared with clients

? Remain in compliance with internal and external policies, procedures, regulations, and standards, including all of ADAC?s policies and procedures and Quality Assurance Plan, State Licensing standards, NAADAC Professional Code of Ethics;

? Participate in all assigned meetings, staff development, and training as required?

? Maintain license including renewal and reporting any changes when necessary?

? Maintain and continue education requirements (CEU?s)

Education, Experience, and Certification

Education requirements as determined by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists for CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure.

Trainee or Supervised experience as approved by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists for CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure. Familiarity and knowledge with relevant software, assessments, case management, and record keeping.

CSC-AD or CAC-AD certification/licensure awarded by the Maryland Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists.

Key Competencies

? Communication skills ? written and verbal

? Planning and organizing

? Prioritizing

? Problem assessment and problem solving

? NAADAC Professional Code of Ethics

? ASAM criteria

? DSM-V criteria

? Information gathering and monitoring

? Attention to detail and accuracy?

? Time management

? Flexibility

? Adaptability?

? Teamwork?

Due to the growing need of substance abuse counseling in our area, an Alcohol & Drug Trainee at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling must be ready and prepared to work at a fast pace. ADAC receives multiple calls from various referral sources throughout each day inquiring information about mutual clients. A counselor must have records up to date in order to relay accurate and timely information to referral sources regarding client attendance, progress, toxicology results, etc. Communication during every work day at ADAC is essential and any unusual occurrences must always be documented. Due to the nature of those we serve it is also important to remember to remain calm in high pressure situations and to respect the needs of these individuals. The clinical staff, including counselors and supervisors, are here to assist you through the learning process and encourage your growth as a counselor. Utilizing the clinical team as well as the administrative team at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling is a great way to clarify questions, familiarize yourself with new material, and solicit advice in a comfortable and supportive environment. Team work is the key to every position at Alternative Drug & Alcohol Counseling.??

Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Everett
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! Outpatient Substance Use Counselor
Lebanon
· Work as part of a strengths and solutions focused program
· Work with individuals with drug & alcohol addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders
· Provide group and individual therapy
· Maintain timely documentation, notes and updates to the treatment plan
· Mix of day and evening hours
· Competitive pay - $30-$35 p/h for PT

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Responsibilities:



Qualifications:

In order to fully support our community as essential workers and ensure the safety of our staff, we are following the safety precautionary measures outlined by the CDC in the event that a face to face meeting is needed. Our staff play an important role during this uncertain time as they respond to those that have been affected by COVID-19 and continue to provide health and wellness services to the community. Therefore, we are still HIRING and looking for passionate individuals to join the team!

Litmus Test: Are we compatible?
Integrity, flexibility, empathy, and excellence are our company values. They motivate us to keep a vibrant company culture that comes through in all we do. Everyone who fits well into our company culture does these things:
This company values your feedback and constructive criticism regarding management, administration, and company policies and procedures. Let your direct supervisor know when you have input.
Pair your complaints and criticisms with solutions.
Instead of saying some version of “that’s not my job” when someone asks you to do something, try some version of “let me see if I can help.” We love delegation and job descriptions too, but it makes for a better workplace when your teammates show a sense of excitement about supporting one another.

Some people can’t imagine doing what we do. We can’t imagine not doing it. At Volunteers of America of Florida, we are more than a non-profit organization. We are a ministry of service with a shared vision of a world where all people live in safety with social, emotional and physical wellbeing, spiritual fulfillment, justice and hope. Volunteers of America has been serving those most in need across the nation since 1896 and in Florida since the 1920’s. Join our dedicated and talented team of employees in 18 Florida cities and make a personal and fulfilling contribution to the people we serve.

Help combat the Opioid Epidemic and save lives. Victory Clinical Services, located in Battle Creek, MI, is seeking to hire a full-time therapist specializing in outpatient substance abuse and co-occurring mental health counseling services for adults. The position includes benefits, professional supervision, the potential for monthly bonuses, and a professional development allowance. Work hours are from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm Monday through Friday, occasional Saturday shifts from 7:00 am to 10:00 am. The clinic is closed Sundays and most major holidays.
Job duties include:
Providing mental health and substance abuse counseling in a consistent, supportive treatment environment.
Facilitating groups.
Performing clinical assessments, intakes and DSM-V diagnoses.

Position Summary
The Counselor is responsible for gathering data, documenting problems and establishing course of treatment. Provides direct addiction treatment services to adult patients and family members.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following and other duties as assigned.
Facilitates individual, group and family counseling to patients assigned and as required.
Function as a liaison with other community based agencies and law enforcement agencies to ensure continuity of care (referrals) and compliance to legal obligations.
Completes accurate and ongoing individual chemical dependency assessment of patients. This includes and is not limited to admission pre-screening calls, intake biopsychosocial assessment, Psychosocial assessment updates, MSW checklist, treatment plan assessments and updates, all documented in the required forms with patient’s input and signature.
New patient charts updated within established time frames. Charts will be current within 30 days.

Access Behavioral Health Services Inc. is looking to hire a dedicated and fun substance abuse counselor at our Boise or Nampa location. An ideal candidate is knowledgeable in the field of substance abuse treatment, finds passion in working with individuals obtaining recovery, commits to following strength-based recovery tools and ideologies, and enjoys working with a dynamic team of other professionals. Access Behavioral Health provides comprehensive outpatient services including; intensive outpatient, outpatient, case management, individual counseling, group counseling, co-occurring and gender specific treatment, adults and adolescents, assessment, and on sight substance testing. While working in the substance abuse treatment department counselors are encouraged and expected to collaborate with other departments to ensure clients receive comprehensive treatment to meet all needs.

$18-$26 plus room for growth

Responsibilities include providing direct/indirect therapy services to outpatients who require or will benefit from therapy skills and interventions. This includes, but is not limited to:

CURRENT OPENING:
Ritter Center is currently recruiting for a Substance Use Disorder Counselor (SUD). This is a full-time, 40-hour a week, non-exempt position reporting to the Behavioral Health Services Manager. This role is based in San Rafael, CA operating out of our Administrative Offices at 30 N. San Pedro. Please find the full job description below.
Position Description:
This is a professional-level position providing services within two programs. A good fit for this position is someone that is able to think on their feet, quickly assess patient needs and implement appropriate treatment plans for those with a history of drug and alcohol challenges. Under supervision, the Substance Use Disorder Counselor (SUD) will provide flexible supportive services to program participants to assist in securing housing in the community and coordinating health care needs. This position will provide case management, counseling, and advocacy services to individuals who are extremely low-income or those experiencing or have experienced homelessness who have had a variety of barriers to permanent housing which may include mental illness, chronic illness, and physical disabilities.

Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Everett
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professional Trainees at our Everett branch to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or SUDP Trainee.

Outpatient Substance Use Counselor
Lebanon

· Work with individuals with drug & alcohol addiction and co-occurring mental health disorders
· Provide group and individual therapy
· Maintain timely documentation, notes and updates to the treatment plan
· Mix of day and evening hours
· Competitive pay - $30-$35 p/h for PT

Job Title: Therapist Substance Abuse LCADC, LCSW or LSW, LPC or LAC
Job Description:
Substance Abuse Facility in Fair Lawn, NJ is looking for a Primary Therapist with providing individual, group and family therapy, crisis intervention services, psycho-education programs and facilitating Prevention groups for clients and their families.
Responsibilities:
Evaluate clients mental and behavioral health, addiction problem and assess their readiness for treatment.
Help clients develop treatment goals and plans.
Review and recommend treatment options with clients and their families.
Help clients develop skills and behaviors necessary to recover from their addiction or modify their behavior.

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Job Title: Seeking a Licensed Therapist and/or MCAP, CAP
Job Description:
Dr. Paul’s at the Bay offers a unique Partial Hospitalization & Intensive Outpatient dual diagnosis treatment experience in a one-of-a-kind setting. This Day Treatment and IOP program provides our clients with desireable structured community housing, if they're interested. We are currently seeking an experienced Substance Abuse and Mental Health Professional who is a CAP or Licensed Therapist. The position requires some program oversight. Applicants should be comfortable facilitating individual and group counseling to clients with the goals of reducing maladaptive behavior and fostering effective psychological functioning.
Requirements include
You a Certified Addiction Professional or Licensed Therapist
Experience working with clients who have a history of trauma (PTSD)

Therapist needed! We are looking for people who understand the power of relationships in creating change. Our therapists work with clients and families who desire change but need the assistance of someone who can help move them in ways that they have not done before.
We have a strong attachment focus with a unique perspective on how attachment impacts both mental health and substance abuse. In our work treating young adult women ages 18-24 we have feel passionately about treating trauma and we will assist in helping each therapist become EMDR trained.
Therapists will provide individual and family therapy for a small case load (7-9 clients) and offer groups to the community of clients in our program. Clients stay for around 9-12 months. This length of stay provides the therapist an opportunity to do amazing work and assist in leading the treatment team to help these young women become healthy, strong and influential in their communities.

Starting pay range: $25-$29/hr.
Schedule: Monday to Friday (no weekends)

Litmus Test: Are we compatible?
Integrity, flexibility, empathy, and excellence are our company values. They motivate us to keep a vibrant company culture that comes through in all we do. Everyone who fits well into our company culture does these things:
This company values your feedback and constructive criticism regarding management, administration, and company policies and procedures. Let your direct supervisor know when you have input.
Pair your complaints and criticisms with solutions.
Instead of saying some version of “that’s not my job” when someone asks you to do something, try some version of “let me see if I can help.” We love delegation and job descriptions too, but it makes for a better workplace when your teammates show a sense of excitement about supporting one another.

Substance Abuse Treatment Counselor
Are you an Addictions Counselor who is passionate about helping patients who suffer from Substance Abuse? Do you have experience working in Behavioral Health / Psych / Detox?

The counselor is a member of a multidisciplinary treatment team, and provides therapeutic services including individual counseling, group counseling, case management, and assessments in a local Correctional Facility. Supervision provided!!
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Overview:
Groups Recover Together was founded in 2014 to make treatment for opioid addiction respectful, accessible and affordable. We empower our members to regain control of their lives through a combination of community support, outpatient weekly group therapy and medication to manage withdrawal using buprenorphine and naltrexone.

What differentiates Groups is the belief that long-term recovery from opioids is tied to aspects of life that are beyond the reach of traditional medical care. We approach fighting addiction as a team sport and provide each member with a care team that works together to ensure our members receive comprehensive, coordinated care. Our outpatient model is designed to fit into our member’s schedules so they can keep working and living a normal life. As a result, our outcomes reflect the success of our model and the commitment of our members with 73% remaining in treatment after 6 months, 90% attending group therapy each week and 89% abstaining from illicit substances each week.

Our staff play an important role during this uncertain time as they respond to those that have been affected by COVID-19 and continue to provide health and wellness services to the community. Job Title: Substance Use Disorder Counselor or Trainee - Shoreline
Job Description:
At Therapeutic Health Services, our mission is to foster healing and recovery. We rehabilitate individuals and heal families affected by alcohol dependence, drug dependence, and/or mental illness, helping them to lead healthy and productive lives. In an average year, our 10 service locations in King and Snohomish counties serve approximately 8,500 adults and over 1,500 youth in our community. Therapeutic Health Services is the largest non-profit provider of medication-assisted treatment for opioid addiction in Washington State. We specialize in treating high-risk, low-income, ethnic minority, multi-system involved, and “harder to serve” adults and youth.
We are hiring immediately! We're needing Substance Abuse Counselor/Substance Abuse Disorder Professionals or Trainees to join our passionate agency plus, be part of the growing field of behavioral health services. Interested candidates must be an experienced Substance Use Disorder Professional or Licensed SUDP Trainee. This position will be based at our Shoreline branch.

Overview
We are looking for team members who are passionate about challenging and significant work for the good of every patient. We are searching for individuals who are compassionate, serve with a purpose, are dedicated to supporting their team, and who seek excellence every day.
Sound like a perfect match? Apply now - we can't wait to hear from you!

Summary:
To provide ongoing intensive case management to clients as defined by MHRH IHH Program Standards; outreach and crisis intervention to dually diagnosed (psychiatrically disabled/chemically dependent) clients according to their level of care. This shall include general medication maintenance substance abuse counseling individual family and group psychotherapy independent living and vocational rehabilitation. Conduct substance abuse treatment with clients in need according to the 12 core functions of substance abuse counseling as defined by the ICRC

Responsibilities:
MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop treatment plans in accordance with Gateway policies/procedures and Medicaid guidelines.

Develop treatment plans to focus on promoting optimal functioning and health of client.

Perform intakes within 30 days ensure completion.




Medical record documentation must be in adherence to Gateway policies and procedures and IHH Medicaid guidelines.

Educates staff regarding clinical intervention strategies related to symptomatology substance abuse sexual abuse and family and relationship issues.




Monitor Medication to ensure client understands prescribed dosage monitor side effects and is taken accordingly.

Maintain caseload of clients assigned by Program Director/Supervisor.

Coordinate activities make appointments and may include accompanying client(s) as noted on Treatment Plan.


Objectives of services to ensure clients active participation in treatment maintenance of a stable residence in community development of ADL skills development of social support network and pursuit/obtainment of employment.

Coordinate Treatment and groups for clients.

When providing therapeutic/counseling/case management services arrives and/or participates on time as scheduled; is alert and responsive to client issues and behaviors.

Participate in daily staff organizational meetings and treatment planning review meetings.

Provide ongoing assessment of client�s mental illness symptoms and client�s response to treatment.

Provide ongoing assessment problem solving side-by-side services skill training supervision (ie assignments monitoring encouragement) and environmental adaptations to assist clients with activities of daily living.

Case Management referral to appropriate services.

Assess clients in crisis for at risk of harm to self or others as per procedure.

ADL skills and house chores to promote optimal independent functioning and stable housing.

Screening for substance abuse and orientation to IHH treatment options

Provide services in the areas of: assessment counseling treatment planning consultation client education and referral pertaining to substance abuse and co-occurring disorders

Attends agency or supervisor required inservices.




Attends other agency inservices.

Participates in at least one course seminar or conference for improvement of job skills per year.

Attends agency IHH staff meetings as scheduled.

Attends Supervisory sessions as scheduled.

Prepares for supervision by completing tasks assigned and formulating questions.

Participates in direct contact with clients family and collateral contacts according to treatment goals. Minimum of 22 hours per week. with the primary focus on substance abuse interactions.




Other duties and responsibilities as assigned or needed.

Center Point’s mission is to provide comprehensive social, educational, vocational, medical, psychological, housing and rehabilitation services to combat social problems such as substance abuse, poverty, unemployment and homelessness.
Center Point is seeking compassionate and enthusiastic individuals with a desire to teach to join one of our exciting teams as a Certified SUD / AOD Counselors at California State Prison,San Quentin (SQ), and other institutions in Northern California.
About the Position:

Therapist needed! We are looking for people who understand the power of relationships in creating change. Our therapists work with clients and families who desire change but need the assistance of someone who can help move them in ways that they have not done before.
We have a strong attachment focus with a unique perspective on how attachment impacts both mental health and substance abuse. In our work treating young adult women ages 18-24 we have feel passionately about treating trauma and we will assist in helping each therapist become EMDR trained.
Therapists will provide individual and family therapy for a small case load (7-9 clients) and offer groups to the community of clients in our program. Clients stay for around 9-12 months. This length of stay provides the therapist an opportunity to do amazing work and assist in leading the treatment team to help these young women become healthy, strong and influential in their communities.

Experience: Experience and expertise in dual diagnosis, 12-step programs and substance abuse,
License: Must possess substance abuse license/certificate as dictated by the State of Washington or equivalent.

Help the most vulnerable.
We Shelter, We Support, We Guide, and We Care for the most vulnerable in our communities.
Some people can’t imagine doing what we do. We can’t imagine not doing it. At Volunteers of America of Florida, we are more than a non-profit organization. We are a ministry of service with a shared vision of a world where all people live in safety with social, emotional and physical wellbeing, spiritual fulfillment, justice and hope. Volunteers of America has been serving those most in need across the nation since 1896 and in Florida since the 1920’s. Join our dedicated and talented team of employees in 18 Florida cities and make a personal and fulfilling contribution to the people we serve.

Overview
We are looking for team members who are passionate about challenging and significant work for the good of every patient. We are searching for individuals who are compassionate, serve with a purpose, are dedicated to supporting their team, and who seek excellence every day.

The EAP Counselor conducts employee counseling and performs other implementation activities in the employee assistance program. Provides assessment, short-term problem resolution, referral and case management services. Addresses a wide range of issues including problems in daily living, psychiatric crisis and violent situations. Provides expertise and specialized knowledge in substance abuse, domestic abuse, grief counseling, workplace problems and management consultation.

Position Summary
The Counselor is responsible for gathering data, documenting problems and establishing course of treatment. Provides direct addiction treatment services to adult patients and family members.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following and other duties as assigned.
Facilitates individual, group and family counseling to patients assigned and as required.
Function as a liaison with other community based agencies and law enforcement agencies to ensure continuity of care (referrals) and compliance to legal obligations.
Completes accurate and ongoing individual chemical dependency assessment of patients. This includes and is not limited to admission pre-screening calls, intake biopsychosocial assessment, Psychosocial assessment updates, MSW checklist, treatment plan assessments and updates, all documented in the required forms with patient’s input and signature.
New patient charts updated within established time frames. Charts will be current within 30 days.

Providing individual, family, and group counseling using Evidence Based Practices.
Assisting patients with defining and achieving realistic goals.

Litmus Test: Are we compatible?
Integrity, flexibility, empathy, and excellence are our company values. They motivate us to keep a vibrant company culture that comes through in all we do. Everyone who fits well into our company culture does these things:
This company values your feedback and constructive criticism regarding management, administration, and company policies and procedures. Let your direct supervisor know when you have input.
